question: Find $\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 5 \\ -2 & 4 \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} 0 & -3 \\ 8 & -5 \end{pmatrix}.$
agents_response:
To add two matrices together, we simply add each corresponding element in the two matrices. Doing that, we find that $\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 5 \\ -2 & 4 \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} 0 & -3 \\ 8 & -5 \end{pmatrix}=\begin{pmatrix} 1+0 & 5+-3 \\ -2+8 & 4+-5 \end{pmatrix}=\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 6 & -1 \end{pmatrix}.$

So, the fully simplified answer is $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 6 & -1 \end{pmatrix}}.$
